item.title: 马哈拉施特拉邦民调接近尾声，熊市包围莫迪股票
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 中国决策者承诺继续推进金融开放
item.description: 在香港举行的一次重要会议上，中国的政策制定者和最高监管机构首次与全球金融界名人公开亮相，誓言继续向外国投资者和企业开放。【原文：China’s policymakers and top regulators vowed to continue its opening up to foreign investors and firms, in their first public appearances with global financial luminaries at a major conference in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 全球资金在印度一级市场的购买量创历史新高
item.description: 自 10 月份以来，外国投资者从印度股票中撤出的资金创下了历史新高，他们纷纷涌入首次公开募股市场，以寻求更好的回报。【原文：Foreign investors are pulling record sums from Indian shares since October and piling into initial public offerings in search for better returns.】

item.title: 据说 Blackstone 接近达成三明治连锁店 Jersey Mike's 的交易
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士透露，Blackstone 公司即将达成协议，以约 80 亿美元（包括债务）收购三明治连锁店 Jersey Mike's。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is close to an agreement to acquire sandwich chain Jersey Mike’s for about $8 billion including debt, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 引领中国股市史诗般反弹的富达基金重新买入股票
item.description: 富达国际（Fidelity International）的乔治-埃夫斯塔索普洛斯（George Efstathopoulos）在 9 月底成功把握住中国股市史诗般的涨势后，再次加仓，因为他预期财政刺激政策将支撑经济。【原文：After successfully riding China’s epic stock rally in late September, Fidelity International’s George Efstathopoulos is boosting positions again on expectations that fiscal stimulus will prop up the economy.】

item.title: 苹果出价 1 亿美元撤销印尼 iPhone 16 禁令
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，苹果公司已将其在印尼的投资报价提高了近十倍，这是这家美国科技巨头说服印尼政府取消 iPhone 16 销售禁令的最新举措。【原文：Apple Inc. has increased its offer to invest in Indonesia by almost tenfold, according to people familiar with the matter, in the US tech giant’s latest bid to persuade the government to lift its sales ban on the iPhone 16.】

item.title: 中国最炙手可热的电动汽车股--新朋股份在跑赢 93% 后面临盈利考验
item.description: 虽然特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc. ）占据了头条新闻，但随着投资者对其产品战略的迅速追捧，新鹏公司（Xpeng Inc.【原文：While Tesla Inc. is grabbing the headlines, Xpeng Inc. has been the hottest electric vehicle stock over the past few months as investors rapidly warm to its product strategy.】

item.title: 美国日益拥抱加密货币，比特币再获助力
item.description: 比特币又回到了历史峰值附近，这主要得益于美国在加密货币啦啦队长唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的带领下，对数字资产行业的支持不断加深。【原文：Bitcoin is back in the vicinity of an all-time peak, supported by a salvo of developments highlighting the deepening embrace of the digital-asset industry in the US under crypto cheerleader Donald Trump.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行认为现金利率适当，并讨论了政策情景
item.description: 澳大利亚央行认为其目前的政策设置是适当的，可以努力降低仍然 "过高 "的核心通胀率，同时在两周前的会议上讨论了可能需要降息、加息或在更长时间内维持较高利率的情况。【原文：Australia’s central bank sees its current policy settings as appropriate to try to pull down core inflation that is still “too high,” while discussing at its meeting two weeks ago scenarios that might require an interest-rate cut, hike or for them to stay higher for longer.】

item.title: 欧洲人工智能初创企业获得的资金达 110 亿美元，创历史新高
item.description: 欧洲人工智能初创企业的融资额虽然还不到美国的四分之一，但由于对构建聊天机器人和自动驾驶汽车的新公司进行了大量投资，今年创下了历史新高。【原文：Funding for European artificial intelligence startups, while still less than a quarter of US figures, hit a record high this year thanks to massive investments in newcomers building chatbots and self-driving cars.】

item.title: HPE 与司法部高层领导会面，以挽救 140 亿美元的瞻博网络交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，惠普企业公司和瞻博网络公司的代表上周会见了司法部的反垄断执法人员，为说服该机构不要质疑他们提出的 140 亿美元交易做最后的努力。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. and Juniper Networks Inc. representatives met with Justice Department antitrust enforcers last week in a final effort to persuade the agency not to challenge their proposed $14 billion deal, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美元走软，油价创逾五周来最大涨幅后保持稳定
item.description: 由于美元走软，风险情绪席卷更广泛的市场，石油价格在创下五周多来最大涨幅后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after the biggest gain in more than five weeks as the dollar weakened and a risk-on tone swept across wider markets.】

item.title: 中国工厂中心地带寻求降低陷入困境的出口商的电力成本
item.description: 中国的工业中心正在寻求降低电价，此举将帮助陷入困境的出口商，同时将一些经济痛苦转移到发电厂身上。【原文：China’s industrial heartland is looking to reduce electricity prices in a move that will help embattled exporters while shifting some economic pain to power plants.】

item.title: BIT Mining 就日本贿赂指控向美国证券交易委员会支付 400 万美元
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周一表示，一家加密货币矿商同意支付 400 万美元的罚款，以了结该委员会对其参与贿赂日本官员计划的指控。【原文：A crypto miner agreed to pay a $4 million penalty to settle US Securities and Exchange Commission allegations that it engaged in a scheme to bribe Japanese officials, the agency said Monday.】

item.title: 黑客窃取国会图书馆与国会办公室之间的电子邮件
item.description: 美国国会图书馆遭到黑客攻击，攻击者获取了图书馆工作人员与国会办公室之间的电子邮件。【原文：The Library of Congress was hacked, and the attackers accessed emails between library staff and congressional offices.】

item.title: 债券上涨，亚洲股市将追随美国股市走高：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市有望追随华尔街股市走高，因为国债止住了推动 10 年期国债收益率接近 4.5%的抛售。交易商也在密切关注当选总统唐纳德-特朗普政府的相关消息。【原文：Asian equities are poised to track Wall Street stocks higher as Treasuries halted a selloff that drove 10-year yields near 4.5%. Traders were also closely watching news around President-elect Donald Trump’s administration.】

item.title: 联邦通信委员会新任主席是埃隆-马斯克的粉丝，而不是多元化倡议的粉丝
item.description: 即将上任的联邦通信委员会主席布兰登-卡尔（Brendan Carr）计划就内容选择问题向大型技术和广播公司提出挑战，并在这个负责监管全国电信、互联网和媒体行业的机构中扼杀多样性和包容性举措。【原文：Brendan Carr, the incoming chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, plans to challenge big technology and broadcast companies over their content choices and kill diversity and inclusion initiatives at the agency that oversees the nation’s telecom, internet and media industries.】

item.title: 否认大屠杀考验科技巨头 Shopify 的言论自由理念
item.description: 加拿大最大的科技公司 Shopify Inc. 因托管一家充斥反犹太主义商品的网店而招致批评，这是对电子商务平台在新的宽松规则下愿意接受什么的一次测试。【原文：Shopify Inc., Canada’s biggest tech company, is drawing criticism for hosting an online store full of antisemitic merchandise, in a test of what the e-commerce platform is willing to accept under a new lighter-touch rulebook.】

item.title: 斯塔默寻求印度贸易协议，即使苏纳克也无法达成
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，他将于明年重启英印自由贸易协定谈判，并为这一协议设定了一个雄心勃勃的目标，就连英国首位印度教首相里希-苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）也未能实现这一目标。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he’d restart talks on a UK-India free trade agreement next year, setting an ambitious goal for a deal that even Rishi Sunak, Britain’s first Hindu premier, couldn’t secure.】

item.title: ADM 重报收益，解决会计问题的最新举措
item.description: 阿彻-丹尼尔斯-米德兰公司（Archer-Daniels-Midland Co.【原文：Archer-Daniels-Midland Co. restated previous earnings, after earlier this month identifying new accounting errors, in a key step to regain investor confidence.】

item.title: 美国蓝筹股债券发行量达到历史第二高水平
item.description: 美国今年的高等级公司债券销售额已攀升至历史第二高水平，原因是企业急于在年底前利用相对低廉的借贷成本。【原文：High-grade corporate bond sales in the US this year have climbed to the second-highest level on record as companies rush to take advantage of relatively affordable borrowing costs before the year ends.】

item.title: 超微股票因合规计划和新审计师而大涨
item.description: 超级微型计算机公司（Super Micro Computer Inc.【原文：Super Micro Computer Inc. shares jumped as much as 21% after the company hired a new auditor and filed a plan to come into compliance with Nasdaq listing requirements.】

item.title: 司法部将推动谷歌出售 Chrome 浏览器以打破搜索垄断
item.description: 美国司法部反垄断高级官员决定要求法官迫使 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司出售 Chrome 浏览器，这将是对全球最大科技公司之一的历史性打击。【原文：Top Justice Department antitrust officials have decided to ask a judge to force Alphabet Inc.’s Google to sell off its Chrome browser in what would be a historic crackdown on one of the biggest tech companies in the world.】

item.title: 惠灵顿在上一轮裁员后数周削减数十个职位
item.description: 惠灵顿管理公司（Wellington Management）在为一批员工启动自愿裁员计划仅几周后，就裁撤了数十个工作岗位。【原文：Wellington Management is eliminating dozens of jobs just weeks after the firm started a voluntary redundancy program for a group of employees.】

item.title: 美国审查后提高新日铁进口关税
item.description: 美国商务部提高了对新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.）的关税，就在这家日本钢铁制造商做出反进口承诺，为其 141 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp.【原文：The US Commerce Department has ratcheted up tariffs on Nippon Steel Corp. just as the Japanese steelmaker made an anti-import promise to gain support for its $14.1 billion takeover of United States Steel Corp.】

item.title: Microchip 的 Moorthy 将卸任首席执行官，由董事长重新接任
item.description: Microchip Technology Inc.首席执行官加内什-莫西（Ganesh Moorthy）将在任职三年后卸任，董事长史蒂夫-桑吉（Steve Sanghi）将重返岗位。【原文：Microchip Technology Inc. Chief Executive Officer Ganesh Moorthy will step down after three years in the role, with Chairman Steve Sanghi returning to the position.】

item.title: 利差收窄，S&P 发现美国信贷泡沫的一些迹象
item.description: S&P全球评级公司的一份报告指出，利差收窄可能掩盖了企业借贷成本高和债务可持续性紧张的问题，标志着美国信贷可能出现泡沫的迹象。【原文：Tight spreads may be obscuring corporations’ high borrowing costs and strained debt sustainability, marking signs of a possible bubble in US credit, according to a report from S&P Global Ratings.】

item.title: Bakkt 因《金融时报》报道与特朗普媒体进行出售谈判而大涨
item.description: 有报道称，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的特朗普媒体与技术集团公司（Trump Media & Technology Group Corp.【原文：Shares of Bakkt Holdings Inc., more than doubled after a report said that President-elect Donald Trump’s Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. is in “advanced talks” to acquire the digital-asset marketplace launched by the parent of the New York Stock Exchange.】

item.title: Thoma Bravo 的 Quorum 软件公司因需求旺盛而获得更低廉的债务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由于直接贷款人的需求旺盛，Quorum Software 锁定了较低的私人信用贷款借贷成本，贷款金额超过了该公司申请金额的六倍多。【原文：Quorum Software locked in lower borrowing costs on a private credit loan thanks to strong demand from direct lenders that exceeded more than six times the amount of money the company asked for, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 欧洲央行武契奇称通胀目标达不到的风险上升
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）表示，欧洲中央银行无法实现 2% 通胀目标的危险已经上升。【原文：The danger that the European Central Bank will fall short of its 2% inflation goal has risen, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic.】
